intro: Hieracium parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium parviflorum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through its rhizomes and seed production.
